text: In affected members of a family with complete androgen insensitivity (300068), Trifiro et al. (1991) found an adenine-to-thymine transversion in exon 8 that changed the sense of codon 882 from lysine to an amber (UAG) translation termination signal. (See 141900.0312 for the origin of the designation 'amber.' See 219700.0030 for an example of the ochre (UAA) type of translation termination signal.)
